str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Thomas, also called Didymus, one of the Twelve. Of Chaldee origin; the twin; Thomas, a Christian.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
The Twin; Didymus, the Greek name equivalent to Thomas. Prolongation from dis; double, i.e. Twin; Didymus, a Christian.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Twelve; the usual way in which the Twelve apostles of Jesus are referred to. From duo and deka; two and ten, i.e. A dozen.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
(a) gen: with, in company with, (b) acc: (1) behind, beyond, after, of place, (2) after, of time, with nouns, neut. of adjectives.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
When, at which time. From hos and te; at which too, i.e. When.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
